components.description: The Liferay Faces Portal facelet component tags with the portal: tag name prefix.

attribute.description: The WAI-ARIA label which can help users with disabilities when a text label is not visible.
attribute.name: ariaLabel

attribute.description: The WAI-ARIA role which can help users with disabilities understand the purpose of an element, such as whether it is a menu, progress indicator, or some other type of component.
attribute.name: ariaRole

component.name: InputRichText
component.description: InputRichText is a UIInput component that renders a field for editing rich text.

attribute.description: Optional map of configuration parameters. For example usage, see the Wiki portlet editor_config.jsp source code.
attribute.name: configParams

attribute.description: The locale (language id) of the rich text content.
attribute.name: contentsLanguageId

attribute.description: Liferay Portal property key name (typically found in portal.properties or portal-ext.properties). Valid property key values are "ckeditor", "ckeditor_bbcode", and "ckeditor_creole". The default key name is "editor.wysiwyg.default" which has a value of "ckeditor".
attribute.name: editorKey

attribute.description: Optional map of file browser parameters. For example usage, see the Wiki portlet editor_config.jsp source code.
attribute.name: fileBrowserParams

attribute.description: The maximum number of plain text characters, meaning characters that do not include HTML tags such as <strong>, <em>, and <a href="...">.
attribute.name: maxPlainTextChars

attribute.description: The minimum number of plain text characters, meaning characters that do not include HTML tags such as <strong>, <em>, and <a href="...">.
attribute.name: minPlainTextChars

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component's value has changed, and then it loses focus.
attribute.name: onchange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: When true, the will be resizable by the end-user when dragging on the bottom-right resize handle. The default value is true.
attribute.name: resizable

attribute.description: When true, the resources necessary for loading the CKEditor will not be added to the <head>...</head> section of the portal page. The default value is false.
attribute.name: skipEditorLoading

attribute.description: The name of the set of toolbars that are to be displayed above the rich text input area. Valid values are "bbcode", "creole", "editInPlace", "email", "liferay", "liferayArticle", "phone", "simple", and "tablet". The default value depends on the value of the editorKey attribute. If editorKey's property evaluates to "ckeditor" then the default value is "liferay". If editorKey's property evaluates to "ckeditor_bbcode" then the default value is "bbcode". If editorKey's property evaluates to "ckeditor_creole" then the default value is "creole".
attribute.name: toolbarSet

component.name: Nav
component.description: Nav is a UIData (iterator) component that renders a <ul>...</ul> (unordered) list. It is designed to be used in conjunction with portal:navItem child component tags.

attribute.description: When true, the unordered list will be surrounded by <div class="collapse nav-collapse">...</div>. This is a responsive layout feature (that works in conjunction with an alloy:navBar parent tag) for small/mobile displays that causes the child alloy:navItem links to be displayed in a popup menu.
attribute.name: responsive

component.name: NavBar
component.description: NavBar is a UIPanel component that renders a <div>...</div> element. It is designed to be used in conjunction with portal:nav and portal:navItem child component tags.

component.name: NavItem
component.description: NavItem is a UIColumn component that renders an <li>...</li> (list item) element. If the href attribute is specified, then an ... anchor tag is rendered inside the list item element.

attribute.description: If the href attribute has a value, then this is the value of the "class" attribute for the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: anchorCssClass

attribute.description: If the href attribute has a value, then this is the child text of the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: anchorData

attribute.description: If the href attribute has a value, then this is the value of the "id" attribute for the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: anchorId

attribute.description: HTML5 data- attributes for the rendered list item element.
attribute.name: data

attribute.description: The URL of the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element. If not specified, then an anchor tag is not rendered.
attribute.name: href

attribute.description: The name of the CSS class of the icon that is to be rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: iconCssClass

attribute.description: The label of the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: When true, the list item will be rendered with class="active".
attribute.name: selected

attribute.description: The title of the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: When true, clicking on the href hyperlink will cause the resulting URL to popup in a modal dialog that contains an iframe.
attribute.name: useDialog

component.name: PermissionsURL
component.description: PermissionsURL is a UIOutput component that generates a URL pointing to the Liferay Portal Permissions UI. If the var attribute is present, the component introduces a variable into the EL. Otherwise, the URL is written to the response.

attribute.description: The Fully-Qualified Class Name (FQCN) of the ServiceBuilder model.
attribute.name: modelResource

attribute.description: The description of the model resource that is to be displayed in the Liferay Portal Permissions UI.
attribute.name: modelResourceDescription

attribute.description: The URL that should be redirected-to when the user clicks on the "Return to Full Page" link in the Liferay Portal Permissions UI.
attribute.name: redirect

attribute.description: The scope group id for the resource. The default value is LiferayFacesContext.getInstance().getScopeGroupId()
attribute.name: resourceGroupId

attribute.description: The primary key used to identify the resource.
attribute.name: resourcePrimKey

attribute.description: An array of type int that corresponds to the roles that are to be displayed in the Liferay Portal Permissions UI. For more info, see com.liferay.portal.model.RoleConstants.
attribute.name: roleTypes

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be introduced into the EL that contains the value of the generated permissions URL. If not specified, then the generated permissions URL is written directly to the response.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: The portlet window state for which the Liferay Portal Permissions UI should be displayed. Valid values include: "maximized", "pop_up", and "exclusive". The default value is "maximized".
attribute.name: windowState

component.name: Runtime
component.description: Runtime is a UIOutput component that generates the markup of an specific Liferay portlet.

attribute.description: TODO.
attribute.name: defaultPreferences

attribute.description: TODO.
attribute.name: portletName

attribute.description: TODO.
attribute.name: queryString
